newsitem.title: JAPAN: Yamaichi says conducted no illegal deals.
newsitem.headline: Yamaichi says conducted no illegal deals.

text.p: Yamaichi Securities Co Ltd said on Friday it had not conducted any illegal deals.
"We did not make any illegal payments to shareholders and we did not make any other deals that violated the law," Yamaichi president Atsuo Miki told the firm's annual shareholders' meeting.

Asked whether Yamaichi had engaged in reported questionable "tobashi" securities transactions with Tokyu Department Store Co Ltd, another Yamaichi executive told the meeting: "We did not engage in such deals."

In tobashi deals, brokerages shift investment losses suffered by one client to another firm, typically one with a different financial year, to prevent a favoured client from having to report the loss.
Earlier this month, Japanese daily Sankei Shimbun said that Yamaichi and Tokyu had conducted tobashi deals between 1987 and 1992.
